title: Nvidia Earnings Show Profit Jumped 65% to $31.9 Billion
summary: The company, which makes the computer chips essential to the artificial intelligence boom, also said revenue in its recent quarter rose to $57 billion.

title: Mexico Is Now the United States’ Top Buyer
summary: For first time in at least 30 years, the United States has exported more to Mexico than Canada, U.S. government data show, in a sign of how much North American trade has consolidated.

title: December Rate Cut in Doubt as Fed Fault Lines Deepen, Minutes Show
summary: The central bank’s decision to lower interest rates last month was more divisive than it first appeared as officials splintered over how to weigh a weakening labor market against rising inflation.

title: After Shutdown, Labor Department Says Some Data is Gone for Good
summary: Surveys were delayed and some cannot be collected at all, officials said, further complicating the Federal Reserve’s decision on interest rates next month.

title: Lindsey Halligan Admits Grand Jury Never Saw Final Comey Indictment
summary: Grand jurors have to vote on indictments to approve them, but a prosecutor told the judge in the case that only the foreperson formally approved the second charging document, a move that could cripple the case.

title: Stalled Contempt Inquiry Into Deportation Flights Springs Back to Life
summary: The resurrected inquiry could finally get to the bottom of lingering questions such as: Did top Trump administration officials purposely ignore a court order?

title: Trump Wanted to Abolish FEMA. His Own Advisers Disagree.
summary: A panel convened by President Trump is said to have rejected the president’s idea that the agency should “go away.”

title: Saudi Arabia’s Prince Has Big Plans, but His Giant Fund Is Low on Cash
summary: After nearly a decade of expensive, hit-and-miss investments, Mohammed bin Salman is overseeing a behind-the-scenes restructuring of the kingdom’s all-important wealth fund.

title: Why Does Trump, the ‘America First’ President, Keep Looking to Foreign Leaders?
summary: Trump keeps showing he is not as isolationist as many supporters had hoped.

title: Melania Trump’s Green Gown Signals Saudi Arabia Diplomatic Ties
summary: At the official dinner for Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the first lady offered an unexpected sign of allegiance.

title: Don’t Tread on Frank: How One Man’s Yard Became a Battlefield
summary: The clash is about strong personalities, an exacting homeowners’ association and a partisan divide that has reached the hyperlocal level.

title: Thanksgiving Pies So Good, You’ll Want to Skip Dinner
summary: Go straight to the good stuff this Thanksgiving: apple and cream, chocolate espresso, honeyed cranberry and more.

title: George Clooney, Adam Sandler and Noah Baumbach on Fame and ‘Jay Kelly’
summary: The stars and the director look back on their days trying to break into the industry and how failure was part of the equation.

title: U.S.-Russian Peace Plan Would Force Ukraine to Cede Land and Cut Army
summary: The 28-point proposal, which comes as the Trump administration tries to restart settlement talks, includes demands long rejected by Kyiv as  nonstarters.

title: Clinicians Lobby for a New Way to Assess the Risk of Suicide
summary: Clinicians often rely on patients to disclose thoughts of self-harm, but some are lobbying for a new diagnosis to better assess the risk.

title: After the Death of Two Titans, Where Are the Next Giant Art Patrons?
summary: With the passing of Leonard A. Lauder and Agnes Gund amid financial headwinds, arts organizations worry that the cultural megadonor may be a thing of the past.

title: Israeli Strikes Kill at Least 25 in Gaza Amid Cease-Fire, Officials Say
summary: Israel’s military said it had launched attacks across Gaza after Palestinian militants shot at its troops. The six-week-old cease-fire has been pierced periodically by bursts of violence.

title: Driving an E.V. Across North Dakota? Thank the Standing Rock Tribe.
summary: A tribally owned network of chargers will soon be complete, connecting reservations and bridging a gap in the Midwest.

title: Robert L. Stirm, Returning P.O.W. in Pulitzer-Winning Photo, Dies at 92
summary: The image immortalized a Vietnam Veteran’s joyous homecoming to his beaming family but hid the painful truth about a marriage that was about to end.

title: NASA Releases Images of Comet 3I/ATLAS Passing by Mars
summary: With the government reopened, the space agency at last released pictures captured by a fleet of government spacecraft of an object that came from beyond our solar system.

title: No, Mr. President, We Cannot ‘Leave It at That’
summary: Working with imperfect partners does not mean that the United States should cover up and lie about their misdeeds.

title: Is Your Community Becoming More Divided?
summary: We want to hear about the ways in which the country’s politics are effecting your neighborhood, in ways big or small.

title: George Conway, a Vocal Foe of Trump, Eyes Congressional Run
summary: The former conservative lawyer built a social media following with his harsh criticism of President Trump, who was the boss of his wife at the time.

title: Believe It or Not, That $12 Million Gold Toilet Was Bought by … Ripley’s
summary: The entertainment company plans on displaying the toilet, saying its team is exploring “whether visitors may someday be allowed to use it.”

title: F.B.I. Hunt Intensifies for Ryan Wedding, Snowboarder Accused of Being a Drug Kingpin
summary: Ryan Wedding, a former Olympic athlete said to be a major cocaine trafficker, is accused of ordering the murder of a witness who was set to testify against him.

title: Newly Discovered Bach Pieces Are the Fruits of Decades of Detective Work
summary: A pair of organ works that scholars believe were written by a teenage Johann Sebastian Bach were premiered in Leipzig this week and added to the composer’s official catalog.
